title: Starting a Terminal
content:
Where to open a terminal

  • macOS: Terminal.app or iTerm2
  • Linux: GNOME Terminal, Konsole, or your desktopâ€™s terminal
  • Remote: SSH from a local terminal

Prompt anatomy

A prompt often shows user, host, and current directory. Example:

ralph@macbook unix-cli-practice %

The symbols differ by shell. The important part is: the shell is ready for a command.

Check which shell you are using

echo "$SHELL"
ps -p $$ -o comm=

Create a safe practice folder

mkdir -p ~/unix-cli-practice
cd ~/unix-cli-practice
pwd

Keyboard basics

  • Ctrl+C: interrupt current program
  • Ctrl+D: end of input (often exits shells/programs)
  • Ctrl+L: clear screen (like clear)
